TITLE: How to Build Resilience in Midlife
SUMMARY: There are active steps you can take during and after a crisis to speed your emotional recovery.

TITLE: How to ‘Winterize’ Your Dog
SUMMARY: Dogs can face special hazards in the colder months, ranging from cracked paws and dry skin to electrocution or immersion in a frozen pond.

TITLE: How Much Sugar Is in a Glass of Wine?
SUMMARY: Winemakers may add sugar to wine to “improve” the taste, and sugar content can vary widely.

TITLE: The Case for a Breakfast Feast
SUMMARY: A new review provides the latest evidence to suggest we should front-load our calories early in the day to jump-start our metabolisms and prevent obesity.

TITLE: Is Coffee Bad for Your Bones?
SUMMARY: Coffee drinkers may excrete more calcium, but it doesn’t appear to weaken bones or cause fractures.

TITLE: Can You Sweat Out Toxins?
SUMMARY: Heavy metals and BPA can be detected in sweat. But whether tiny amounts of chemicals present a health concern is unknown.

TITLE: Age Like a Former Athlete
SUMMARY: Squirreling away fitness when we are young with sustained, frequent exercise might help to blunt some of the losses from aging.

TITLE: Why Does My Dentist Give Me So Many X-Rays?
SUMMARY: Dentists should not rely on a blanket policy on X-rays for all patients, according to guidelines set out by the American Dental Association.

TITLE: When Your Teenager Asks, ‘Did You Smoke Weed?’
SUMMARY: A teenager asking, ‘What choice did you make?’ is often wondering, ‘What choice should I make?’

TITLE: Can Air-Conditioners Cause Sinus Congestion?
SUMMARY: Air-conditioners can make some people’s noses clog or run for several reasons.

TITLE: Ask Well: Red Cabbage vs. Blueberries?
SUMMARY: Red cabbage is not as high as blueberries in the antioxidants that give these foods a blue or purple color, but it contains other healthful nutrients.

TITLE: Mediterranean Diet vs. Statins to Prevent Heart Attack and Stroke?
SUMMARY: The Mediterranean diet helps even if you are taking statins and, along with other benefits, might help avoid the need for statins altogether.

SUMMARY: Scientists may have uncovered for the first time why taking deep breaths can be so calming.

TITLE: How to Be Mindful if Your Flight Is Delayed
SUMMARY: Running late is stressful, but a delayed flight is an especially good moment to be mindful.
